page.title: 06ST.MATTHEWS CHURCH N.WALTHAM
page.content: As{New Waltham}got bigger and more people came to live here, people thought that the village needed its own church.The nearest churches where in Waltham and Humberston. The villagers and helpers built the church themselves because they couldn't afford to have one built.They made every block and carried them the three miles from Waltham.They started in 1933 and finished in May 1934 calling it the' mission hall.' In September 1984 a new church,now called{St.Matthews}was started because the old one had become dangerous.It will be opened in September 1985.It will hold 185 people.The old church walls will be knocked down to one metre in height and made into a garden so that noboby will forget the hard work which went into building the old mission hall in 1933.
